verses.kjv: Hear, O Israel: Thou art to pass over Jordan this day, to go in to possess nations greater and mightier than thyself, cities great and fenced up to heaven,
verses.web: Hear, Israel! You are to pass over the Jordan today, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourself, cities great and fortified up to the sky,
verses.ct: Listen, Israel! Today you are about to cross the Jordan to take over nations that are bigger and more powerful than you. Their cities are massive, with walls that seem to reach the sky.

verses.kjv: A people great and tall, the children of the Anakims, whom thou knowest, and of whom thou hast heard say, Who can stand before the children of Anak!
verses.web: a people great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom you know, and of whom you have heard say, “Who can stand before the sons of Anak?”
verses.ct: The people living there are tall and strong — the descendants of the Anakim. You know about them, and you've heard people say, "Who can stand against the sons of Anak?"

verses.kjv: Understand therefore this day, that the LORD thy God is he which goeth over before thee; as a consuming fire he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before thy face: so shalt thou drive them out, and destroy them quickly, as the LORD hath said unto thee.
verses.web: Know therefore today that LORD your God is he who goes over before you as a devouring fire. He will destroy them and he will bring them down before you. So you shall drive them out and make them perish quickly, as LORD has spoken to you.
verses.ct: But understand this today: the LORD your God is going ahead of you like a consuming fire. He will destroy them and bring them down in front of you, so you will drive them out and wipe them out quickly, just as the LORD promised you.

verses.kjv: Speak not thou in thine heart, after that the LORD thy God hath cast them out from before thee, saying, For my righteousness the LORD hath brought me in to possess this land: but for the wickedness of these nations the LORD doth drive them out from before thee.
verses.web: Don’t say in your heart, after LORD your God has thrust them out from before you, “For my righteousness LORD has brought me in to possess this land;” because LORD drives them out before you because of the wickedness of these nations.
verses.ct: After the LORD your God has driven them out ahead of you, don't tell yourself, "The LORD gave me this land because I deserved it." No — the LORD is driving these nations out because of their wickedness.

verses.kjv: Not for thy righteousness, or for the uprightness of thine heart, dost thou go to possess their land: but for the wickedness of these nations the LORD thy God doth drive them out from before thee, and that he may perform the word which the LORD sware unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.web: Not for your righteousness or for the uprightness of your heart do you go in to possess their land; but for the wickedness of these nations LORD your God does drive them out from before you, and that he may establish the word which LORD swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.ct: It's not because of your righteousness or your good heart that you're going in to take their land. The LORD your God is driving them out because of their wickedness, and to keep the promise the LORD made to your ancestors — Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.kjv: Understand therefore, that the LORD thy God giveth thee not this good land to possess it for thy righteousness; for thou art a stiffnecked people.
verses.web: Know therefore that LORD your God doesn’t give you this good land to possess for your righteousness, for you are a stiff-necked people.
verses.ct: So get this straight: the LORD your God is not giving you this good land because you've earned it. The truth is, you are a stubborn people.

verses.kjv: Remember, and forget not, how thou provokedst the LORD thy God to wrath in the wilderness: from the day that thou didst depart out of the land of Egypt, until ye came unto this place, ye have been rebellious against the LORD.
verses.web: Remember, and don’t forget, how you provoked LORD your God to wrath in the wilderness. From the day that you left the land of Egypt until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against LORD.
verses.ct: Remember — and don't you ever forget — how you provoked the LORD your God to anger in the wilderness. From the day you left Egypt until you arrived here, you have been rebelling against the LORD.

verses.kjv: Also in Horeb ye provoked the LORD to wrath, so that the LORD was angry with you to have destroyed you.
verses.web: Also in Horeb you provoked LORD to wrath, and LORD was angry with you to destroy you.
verses.ct: Even at Horeb you made the LORD so furious that he was ready to destroy you.

verses.kjv: When I was gone up into the mount to receive the tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant which the LORD made with you, then I abode in the mount forty days and forty nights, I neither did eat bread nor drink water:
verses.web: When I had gone up onto the mountain to receive the stone tablets, even the tablets of the covenant which LORD made with you, then I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water.
verses.ct: When I climbed the mountain to receive the stone tablets — the tablets of the covenant the LORD made with you — I stayed there for 40 days and 40 nights without eating any food or drinking any water.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered unto me two tables of stone written with the finger of God; and on them was written according to all the words, which the LORD spake with you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
verses.web: LORD delivered to me the two stone tablets written with God’s finger. On them were all the words which LORD spoke with you on the mountain out of the middle of the fire in the day of the assembly.
verses.ct: The LORD gave me 2 stone tablets inscribed by the finger of God himself. Written on them were all the words the LORD had spoken to you from the fire on the mountain, on the day you were all assembled there.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights, that the LORD gave me the two tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant.
verses.web: It came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights that LORD gave me the two stone tablets, even the tablets of the covenant.
verses.ct: At the end of those 40 days and 40 nights, the LORD handed me the 2 stone tablets — the tablets of the covenant.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Arise, get thee down quickly from hence; for thy people which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt have corrupted themselves; they are quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made them a molten image.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Arise, get down quickly from here; for your people whom you have brought out of Egypt have corrupted themselves. They have quickly turned away from the way which I commanded them. They have made a molten image for themselves!”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, "Get up and go back down immediately! Your people that you brought out of Egypt have already corrupted themselves. They've quickly abandoned the path I commanded them to follow. They've made an idol out of melted metal."

verses.kjv: Furthermore the LORD spake unto me, saying, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked people:
verses.web: Furthermore LORD spoke to me, saying, “I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people.
verses.ct: The LORD also said to me, "I've been watching this people, and they are as stubborn as they come.

verses.kjv: Let me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under heaven: and I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.
verses.web: Leave me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under the sky; and I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they.”
verses.ct: Step aside and let me destroy them. I will wipe their name off the face of the earth, and I will make you into a nation even mightier and larger than they are."

verses.kjv: So I turned and came down from the mount, and the mount burned with fire: and the two tables of the covenant were in my two hands.
verses.web: So I turned and came down from the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire. The two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
verses.ct: So I turned and came back down the mountain while it was still blazing with fire, carrying the 2 covenant tablets in my hands.

verses.kjv: And I looked, and, behold, ye had sinned against the LORD your God, and had made you a molten calf: ye had turned aside quickly out of the way which the LORD had commanded you.
verses.web: I looked, and behold, you had sinned against LORD your God. You had made yourselves a molded calf. You had quickly turned away from the way which LORD had commanded you.
verses.ct: When I looked, I saw it for myself — you had sinned against the LORD your God. You had made yourselves a molten calf. You had already turned away from the path the LORD had commanded you to follow.

verses.kjv: And I took the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and brake them before your eyes.
verses.web: I took hold of the two tablets, and threw them out of my two hands, and broke them before your eyes.
verses.ct: I grabbed the 2 tablets and hurled them from my hands, smashing them to pieces right in front of you.

verses.kjv: And I fell down before the LORD, as at the first, forty days and forty nights: I did neither eat bread, nor drink water, because of all your sins which ye sinned, in doing wickedly in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
verses.web: I fell down before LORD, as at the first, forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water, because of all your sin which you sinned, in doing that which was evil in LORD’s sight, to provoke him to anger.
verses.ct: Then I threw myself facedown before the LORD for another 40 days and 40 nights, just like the first time, without eating food or drinking water. I did this because of all the sin you had committed — the evil you had done that provoked the LORD to anger.

verses.kjv: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, wherewith the LORD was wroth against you to destroy you. But the LORD hearkened unto me at that time also.
verses.web: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure with which LORD was angry against you to destroy you. But LORD listened to me that time also.
verses.ct: I was terrified of the LORD's fierce anger, because he was furious enough to destroy you. But the LORD listened to me that time as well.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was very angry with Aaron to have destroyed him: and I prayed for Aaron also the same time.
verses.web: LORD was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him. I prayed for Aaron also at the same time.
verses.ct: The LORD was also angry enough with Aaron to destroy him, so I prayed for Aaron at the same time.

verses.kjv: And I took your sin, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, and ground it very small, even until it was as small as dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount.
verses.web: I took your sin, the calf which you had made, and burned it with fire, and crushed it, grinding it very small, until it was as fine as dust. I threw its dust into the brook that descended out of the mountain.
verses.ct: Then I took that sinful thing you had made — the calf — and burned it in the fire. I crushed it and ground it into powder as fine as dust, then threw the dust into the stream that flowed down from the mountain.

verses.kjv: And at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibrothhattaavah, ye provoked the LORD to wrath.
verses.web: At Taberah, at Massah, and at Kibroth Hattaavah you provoked LORD to wrath.
verses.ct: You also provoked the LORD to anger at Taberah, at Massah, and at Kibrothhattaavah.

verses.kjv: Likewise when the LORD sent you from Kadeshbarnea, saying, Go up and possess the land which I have given you; then ye rebelled against the commandment of the LORD your God, and ye believed him not, nor hearkened to his voice.
verses.web: When LORD sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, “Go up and possess the land which I have given you,” you rebelled against the commandment of LORD your God, and you didn’t believe him or listen to his voice.
verses.ct: And when the LORD sent you from Kadeshbarnea, saying, "Go up and take possession of the land I've given you," you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God. You didn't trust him, and you didn't listen to him.

verses.kjv: Ye have been rebellious against the LORD from the day that I knew you.
verses.web: You have been rebellious against LORD from the day that I knew you.
verses.ct: You have been rebelling against the LORD for as long as I've known you.

verses.kjv: Thus I fell down before the LORD forty days and forty nights, as I fell down at the first; because the LORD had said he would destroy you.
verses.web: So I fell down before LORD the forty days and forty nights that I fell down, because LORD had said he would destroy you.
verses.ct: So I lay facedown before the LORD for those 40 days and 40 nights, because the LORD had declared that he would destroy you.

verses.kjv: I prayed therefore unto the LORD, and said, O Lord GOD, destroy not thy people and thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed through thy greatness, which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.web: I prayed to LORD, and said, “Lord LORD, don’t destroy your people and your inheritance that you have redeemed through your greatness, that you have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.ct: I prayed to the LORD and said, "Lord GOD, please don't destroy your people — your own inheritance that you rescued through your greatness and brought out of Egypt with your mighty hand.

verses.kjv: Remember thy servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; look not unto the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin:
verses.web: Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Don’t look at the stubbornness of this people, nor at their wickedness, nor at their sin,
verses.ct: Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Don't focus on how stubborn this people is, or on their wickedness and sin.

verses.kjv: Lest the land whence thou broughtest us out say, Because the LORD was not able to bring them into the land which he promised them, and because he hated them, he hath brought them out to slay them in the wilderness.
verses.web: lest the land you brought us out from say, ‘Because LORD was not able to bring them into the land which he promised to them, and because he hated them, he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.’
verses.ct: If you destroy them, the Egyptians will say, 'The LORD wasn't powerful enough to bring them into the land he promised. He hated them, so he brought them into the wilderness to kill them.'

verses.kjv: Yet they are thy people and thine inheritance, which thou broughtest out by thy mighty power and by thy stretched out arm.
verses.web: Yet they are your people and your inheritance, which you brought out by your great power and by your outstretched arm.”
verses.ct: But they are still your people — your own inheritance — the ones you brought out of Egypt by your great power and your outstretched arm."
